result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee E Mathews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee E Mathews

records.addlTxt:
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Testificandum
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that a Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Testificandum be issued directing the warden to deliver Lee E Mathews to the Sheriff of Eau Claire County, Wisconsin, so the said Sheriff may transport the witness before the Honorable Emily M. Long, of the Eau Claire County Circuit Court, at the Courthouse in the City of Eau Claire, Wisconsin, on or before December 01, 2022 at 9:00 and December 02, 2022 at 9:00 AM, and immediately after, the Sheriff of Eau Claire County return Lee E Mathews to a destination ordered by the Court.
Proposed Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Testificandum

9:34 AM cases 22CM555, 22CM610 called. Defendant Lee E Mathews appeared by video, in custody in Jackson County.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Lee E Mathews.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense recites the joint agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. .
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 Obstructing an Officer in 22CM610 and Count 1 Misdemeanor Retail Theft in 22CM555. 
Court accepts pleas, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court orders court costs on each count and 2 days in Jail with 2 days credit on each count.

(11:13 AM cases 22CM555, 22CM610 called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lee E Mathews appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Lee E Mathews.
Court orders warrant in 22CM555 is quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 8, 2022 at 2 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
